result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonah Russell Ahrens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay court costs to the Ozaukee County Clerk of Court's office during the period of Extended Supervision on 20Cm310/20CM313. Failure to do so will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Prison sentence on 20CM310/20CM313 and any other sentence.

Defendant to pay court costs to the Ozaukee County Clerk of Court's office during the period of Extended Supervision on 20Cm310/20CM313. Failure to do so will result in a civil judgment.The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).
Defendant to pay court costs to the Ozaukee County Clerk of Court's office during the period of Extended Supervision on 20Cm310/20CM313. Failure to do so will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Prison sentence on 20CM310/20CM313 and Ct. 2 of 22CF112.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
01:50 PM  Defendant Jonah Russell Ahrens in court in person, in the custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Attorney Martin Russell Tanz.  Attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for State of Wisconsin. Officer Andrews (Cedarburg PD) sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Stumbris, crossexam by Atty. Tanz, Exam by Court. Court finds probable cause, binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on May 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. No violent contact with anyone.

1:04 PM Defendant Jonah Russell Ahrens appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Heather Dvoran.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD. Defendant does not have a cell phone #, address is correct. Defense waives reading of the complaint. Court finds probable cause. State recommends $7500 cash bail. Court orders $7500 cash bail w/conditions. Court is informed there is a probation hold. Defendant requests a preliminary hearing w/in 10 days.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
